Layer.onTouchMove

Function/Meaning
Finger moved
Type
Event of the Layer class
Syntax
onTouchMove(x, y, cx, cy, id)
Arguments
x The x-coordinate of the touch position (in client coordinates).
y The y-coordinate of the touch position (in client coordinates).
cx The number of horizontal pixels the finger is in contact with.
Always 1 if the device does not support this.
cy The number of vertical pixels the finger is in contact with.
Always 1 if the device does not support this.
id Touch ID.
During multi-touch, a unique value is set for each position, and this ID can be used to identify the position.
Description
Occurs when a finger touching the touch panel moves.
This event occurs when the X and Y coordinates are within this layer.
However, unlike a mouse, it is determined by the current coordinates, so it may not be the same layer where onTouchDown occurred.
